data.title: Parenthesis
data.statement:
In school, you have been taught to use [] and {} for second and third outer parenthesis in math. Given an input string which is a valid math expression, without spaces between characters and operators nor characters and parenthesis, convert the parenthesis to use the form described above.

For example, (1+(2+(3+4))) will covert to {1+[2+(3+4)]}. As another example, given (1+2+(3+4)) you will output [1+2+(3+4)].

If two type of parenthesis can be put in one spot, the parenthesis that is used for higher level takes the precedence. (1+(2+3)+(4+(5+6))) will go to {1+(2+3)+[4+(5+6)]}.
data.constraints:
The expression given is in proper form i.e. every opening parenthesis has a matching closing parenthesis. 
The expression will also not contain more than three pairs of nested parenthesis.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read expr:string(N)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The length of the string [[N]].
<<Line 2:>> The expression to be converted to the proper parenthetical form.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The expression with the proper parenthetical form.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In school, you have been taught to use [] and {} for second and third outer parenthesis in math. Given an input string which is a valid math expression, without spaces between characters and operators nor characters and parenthesis, convert the parenthesis to use the form described above.

For example, (1+(2+(3+4))) will covert to {1+[2+(3+4)]}. As another example, given (1+2+(3+4)) you will output [1+2+(3+4)].

If two type of parenthesis can be put in one spot, the parenthesis that is used for higher level takes the precedence. (1+(2+3)+(4+(5+6))) will go to {1+(2+3)+[4+(5+6)]}.
Input
Line 1: The length of the string N.
Line 2: The expression to be converted to the proper parenthetical form.
Output
Line 1: The expression with the proper parenthetical form.
Constraints
The expression given is in proper form i.e. every opening parenthesis has a matching closing parenthesis.
The expression will also not contain more than three pairs of nested parenthesis.
Example
Input
13
(1+(2+(3+4)))
Output
{1+[2+(3+4)]}
